title: Electric field between plate and cylinder

content.question: A conducting plate and a conducting cylinder are connected to a battery, as shown above. Which of the following best represents the electric field between the two objects?

choices.label: The electrical field consists of 3 straight arrows directed from the bottom surface of the cylinder to the top surface of the plate. Moving from left to right from the bottom cylinder surface, the left arrow points to the left top plate edge, the center arrow points to the top of the center of the plate, the right arrow points to the top right plate edge.

The electrical field consists of 3 straight arrows directed from the top surface of the plate to the bottom surface of the cylinder. Moving from left to right from the plate surface, the left arrow points from the left edge to the bottom surface of the cylinder, the center arrow points from the center to the bottom cylinder surface, the right arrow points from the right edge to the bottom cylinder surface.

The electrical field consists of 3 arrows directed from the top surface of the plate to the bottom surface of the cylinder. Moving from left to right from the top of the plate, the left arrow starts at the left plate edge, moves horizontally to the right and then curves up vertically to the bottom of the cylinder, the center arrow is straight and points from the center top of the plate to the bottom of the cylinder, the right arrow starts at the right plate edge moves horizontally to the left and then curves up vertically to the bottom of the cylinder.

The electrical field consists of 5 arrows directed from the cylinder to the top surface of the plate. Moving from left to right, the left most arrow starts at the left edge of the cylinder and curves slightly outward before reaching the left edge of the plate. The next arrow is just to the right of this arrow and also point from the cylinder to the plate with a slight outward curve. The center arrow is straight and point from the center of the cylinder to the center of the plate. The fourth arrows is to the right of the center and points from the cylinder to the plate with a slight outward curve. The last arrow starts at the right edge of the cylinder and curves slightly outward before reaching the right edge of the plate.

The electrical field consists of 5 arrows directed from the top surface of the plate to the cylinder. Moving from left to right, the left most arrow starts at the left edge of the plate and curves slightly outward before reaching the left edge of the cylinder. The next arrow is just to the right of this arrow and also points from the plate to the cylinder with a slight outward curve. The center arrow is straight and points from the center of the plate to the center of the cylinder. The fourth arrow is to the right of the center and points from the plate to the cylinder with a slight outward curve. The last arrow starts at the right edge of the plate and curves slightly outward before reaching the right edge of the cylinder.

content.answer: The electrical field consists of 5 arrows directed from the top surface of the plate to the cylinder. Moving from left to right, the left most arrow starts at the left edge of the plate and curves slightly outward before reaching the left edge of the cylinder. The next arrow is just to the right of this arrow and also points from the plate to the cylinder with a slight outward curve. The center arrow is straight and points from the center of the plate to the center of the cylinder. The fourth arrow is to the right of the center and points from the plate to the cylinder with a slight outward curve. The last arrow starts at the right edge of the plate and curves slightly outward before reaching the right edge of the cylinder.

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
